welcome back to superstition mountain first thing i want to do is thank everybody who has subscribed to my channel and also thank all those who have taken

the way that those lessons work is first i have you film yourself from down the line and face on send those swings in
schedule an appointment with me and we get on a zoom call and in that call it's either zoom or face time and in that call i will walk you through some
drills and feels that will help you to improve your swing so let's get on with today's
lesson so here you can see this is my favorite setup for practicing i've gotten a limonade so one behind the ball
and one in front of the ball then i've got a plane stick in the ground that keeps me from getting out over the top of the golf ball so i'm going to hit that
inside of the golf ball so here's a pretty clear view of how to set this up you can see the alignment sticks
and then the plane stick goes back about two feet two and a half feet behind the ball on the target line about four inches outside of the target line
so you can really see that from these different angles and it's matching the plane of the shaft of the club you are swinging
now the goal here is to make our backswing trace the stick on the ground
and then our downswing we transition and we make sure we don't transition the club out because if i do that i'm going to hit the shaft of the club on
the stick here there's a couple ways we could make ourselves swing under this stick we can swing back and feel like we stay turned and that will get us under the stick
or we can swing back and feel like we're unwinding and we're making the club head stay back i prefer the second one so if i feel like
the club transitions and stays back now i can turn into the golf ball and get the ball to start down my target line which is my goal
okay so it should look something like this so use this station i know it will help you to figure out how to stop tipping the club out
what it feels like to get the club to stay back and be able to turn into the golf ball now i'm not the most creative guy
